definitions.definition: The left side of a horse or of a team of horses pulling a carriage etc.
To come closer to; to approach.

definitions.example: I can't see near objects very clearly without my glasses.
The deceased man had no near relatives.

definitions.definition: Close to one's interests, affection, etc.; intimate; dear.
Close to anything followed or imitated; not free, loose, or rambling.
definitions.example: a version near to the original

definitions.definition: So as barely to avoid or pass injury or loss; close; narrow.

definitions.example: The two words are near synonyms.

definitions.definition: (in relation to a vehicle) On the side nearest to the kerb (the left-hand side if one drives on the left).
definitions.example: The near front wheel came loose.

definitions.definition: Next to the driver, when he is on foot; on the left of an animal or a team.
definitions.example: the near ox; the near leg

definitions.definition: At or towards a position close in space or time.

definitions.example: He was near unconscious when I found him.

definitions.definition: Physically close to, in close proximity to.
definitions.example: There are habitable planets orbiting many of the stars near our Sun.

definitions.definition: Close to in nature or degree.
definitions.example: His opinions are near the limit of what is acceptable.
